result.execSummary:
The defendant Nick Damato Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 1-9-15 AT 1:30 PM.

miscConds.notes:
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming. Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay costs and disbursements for case 2013CM5388. Restitution is set at zero.
Mental Health Treatment and take all prescribed medications.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  No contact with victim, Erica G., without approval of the court.  No violent contact with victim Rachel M. Parties may not reside together. Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children (supervised).

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

No firearms; weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review on 1-9-15 at 1:30 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nick Damato Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/22/14. AR

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Rachel M. 

AS TO AMENDED CHARGE: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to all other sentences), with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 48 MONTHS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Mental Health Treatment and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Erica G., without approval of the court.
   No violent contact with victim Rachel M.  
   ---- Parties may not reside together.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children (supervised).
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
    Pay costs and disbursements for case 2013CM5388.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 1-9-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-17-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued in full force per order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #2, to Substantial Battery Intent Bodily Harm (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(2) and 968.075(1)(a) a Felony I."   State to file an Amended Information on the date of Sentencing.  mld

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Upon the request of both parties, all three cases; 2013CF5758, 2013CM5170, 2014CF000002 and 2013CM5388 are adjourned for a Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-27-2014 at 8:30 am.  

Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 5-27-2014 regarding case 2013CM5388.  

Court ordered all conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order with the victim, no alcohol, no drugs and absolute sobriety.   mld

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Cases 2013CF5858, 2013CM5170 and 2014CF000002 adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-19-2014 at 8:30 am.  

There is a different victim on case 2013CM5388, which is scheduled for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-27-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on Count #2 on behalf of defendant.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: 2013CM5170, 2013CF5758, 2014CF000002.  There is a different victim on case 2013CM5388, therefore, this case will be tried separately, per the Court.  Defense objected to the joinder of cases.   Defense counsel should have receipt of all discovery on all (4) four cases for defendant.  Offer will be forthcoming, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-11-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court ordered defendant to have no contact with the victims named on the complaint and no violations of the law.   mld

Defendant Nick Damato in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Frederick Terriquez (case 2014CF000002).  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Upon the request of the State, case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 1-22-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail including no contact with the named victim in complaint are ordered until further order of the Court.  Defendant has two other pending cases calendared for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 1-22-2014: Cases 2013CM5170 and 2013CM5388.   mld

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. As to Count 1:
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty.
